intro: Phaeopappus cappadocicus, commonly known as the Cappadocian yellow pappus, is a rare flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and pappus structures. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, while its stems are erect and covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
